instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin when LCD is plugged in
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had liquid damage. It powers on and posts when the LCD is unplugged, but once you plug it in it will only quarter fan spin. Ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin when LCD is plugged in
threads.message: Tried another LCD? Could be short in cable/LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin when LCD is plugged in
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin when LCD is plugged in
threads.message: Short on L9008 with LCD plugged in? Remove L9008 and see if it will power on this way.
